strings.xml_iso19139: Save this metadata as an ISO19139 XML file
strings.xml_iso19139Tooai_dc: Save this metadata as an OAI Dublin Core XML file

eea-date-help.div: Set at least the creation date and the publication date for a dataset published on EEA website

eea-edition-help.div: If the dataset has a revision number (such as the Corine Land Cover changes 1990-2000 version 13), this revision number shall be written in this metadata element.

eea-identifier-help.div: This identifier shall be unique and ideally meaningful. This identifier shall be set to the directory name (written according to this convention) in which the dataset is contained.

eea-classification-help.div:
Select first:
At least one topic defined by ISO (defaults in EEA template are environment and geoscientific information but adapt them if needed)
One of the 34 INSPIRE themes
Then optionnaly improve the categorization and search by adding:
GEMET themes
EEA keywords
EEA category is always geospatial data for resources published on the SDI. If you really need to add more keywords, switch to the full view.

eea-contact-help.div: Describe at least the point of contact and the custodian for the resources. Try to pick contact from the list of predefined entries. Use the only if the contact is not registered on the list. Contact sdi [at] eea.europa.eu if you think a new contact should be added to the register.

eea-resourceConstraints-help.div:
For use limitation, use the following text if EEA data re-use policy applies, otherwise add the applicable policy
Unless otherwise indicated, re-use of content on the EEA website for commercial or non-commercial purposes is permitted free of charge, provided that the source is acknowledged. The EEA re-use policy follows Directive 2003/98/EC of the European Parliament and the Council on the re-use of public sector information throughout the European Union and Commission Decision 2006/291/EC, Euratom on the re-use of Commission information. The EEA accepts no responsibility or liability whatsoever for the re-use of content accessible on its website. Any inquiries about re-use of content on the EEA website should be addressed to Ove Caspersen, EEA, Kongens Nytorv 6, DK-1050 Copenhagen K, Tel +45 33 36 71 00, Fax +45 33 36 71 99, e-mail copyrights at eea.europa.eu

eea-associatedResource-help.div: Define here at least one graphic overview and links to the resource for data access. Define the link for internal access using the protocol "EEA:FILEPATH" and a link for web download access. Optionally add a link to a related services using "OGC:WMS" and/or "ESRI:REST" protocols.

strings.addSpatialRepresentationType: Add spatial representation type (ie. grid, vector, text)
strings.linkToPortal-help: Read here the full details and access to the data.
strings.citationProposal-help: This proposal was automatically generated, check if the metadata authors did not specified custom citation requirements.
strings.invalidElement: Invalid element. Invalid content was found starting with element:
strings.missingElement: Missing element. The content of element:
strings.notValidFor: is not a valid value for
strings.enum2: is not valid for the field
strings.add-resource-idHelp: Compose the resource identifier using the catalog URL and the metadata identifier (eg. http://www.organization.org/catalogue/5391bf69-44bc-4ea0-8cc0-6cf6c3bc81ae).
strings.add-extent-from-geokeywordsHelp: Analyze each keyword of type place and add matching extent.
strings.sds-add-dataqualityHelp: TG4: For each spatial data service, there shall be one and only one set of quality information (dataQualityInfo element) scoped to “service”.
strings.sds-add-tech-specHelp: TG8: The Specification metadata element shall at least refer to or contain one technical specification to which the invocable spatial data service fully conforms, providing all the necessary technical elements, to actually invoke the service and enable its usage.
strings.sds-add-qualityofservice: Add missing Quality of Service criteria
strings.sds-add-qualityofserviceHelp: INSPIRE SDS requires three quality of service criteria to be reported in the metadata: Availability, Performance and Capacity. This button will add the missing criteria.
strings.sds-fix-categoryHelp: (Rec1) Replace gco:CharacterString with gmx:Anchor in the description metadata element.
strings.sds-addNoConstraintsHelp: Add an element that documents that there are no limitation for this service.
